text: Expression of <extra_id_0> tal-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and GATA - binding proteins during human hematopoiesis .
<extra_id_0> Tal-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> rearrangements are associated with nearly 30 % of human T acute lymphoblastic leukemia .

<extra_id_0> Tal-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene encodes a putative transcription factor with a basic helix-loop-helix domain and is known to be predominantly expressed in hematopoietic cells .

We investigated the pattern of <extra_id_0> tal-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in purified human hematopoietic cells by in situ hybridization and reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction analysis .
Both methods demonstrated that the <extra_id_0> tal-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is expressed in megakaryocytes and erythroblasts as well as in basophilic granulocytes .
In addition , our results indicate that the <extra_id_0> tal-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 1A promoter , which contains two consensus GATA - binding sites , is active mainly in these lineages .

Because the <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is known to transactivate several genes specific for the erythroid , megakaryocytic , and mastocytic / basophilic lineages , we studied <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in these purified hematopoietic cells .
We found that <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> tal-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes are coexpressed in these three lineages .
Remarkably , the expression of both genes is downmodulated during erythroid and megakaryocytic terminal maturation .

In immature hematopoietic cells , <extra_id_0> tal-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> genes are coexpressed in committed progenitors cells ( <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / <extra_id_0> CD38 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 2+ ) ) , whereas they are not detectable in the most primitive cells ( <extra_id_0> CD34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 2+ ) / <extra_id_0> CD38 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - ) .

In contrast , <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is strongly expressed in both most primitive and committed progenitors cells , whereas <extra_id_0> GATA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is mostly detected in most primitive ones .

Altogether our results strongly suggest that <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> modulates the transcription of <extra_id_0> tal-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> during the differentiation of the erythroid , megakaryocytic , and basosophilic lineages .
